Reviews.Title: “Good service, dwindling location”
Reviews.Author: k5tm
Reviews.Content: The west end of downtown Dallas is being allowed to slip away. The city really should do something about the panhandling and other issues that detract from its value. That said, the Crowne Plaza is a decent hotel that needs to pay a bit more attention to its housekeeping. My room was renovated and had new carpet, for example. However, when I dropped something on the floor, I found a seed of some sort where it should have been vacuumed. On the second day of my stay, the bed top cover was left on the floor after housekeeping had made up the room. The bath was smallish -- something you cannot fix with a renovation. Hotel was unable to honor my request for a king.

Reviews.Title: “Gross and SCARY!”
Reviews.Author: Tim10L
Reviews.Content: Nothing like pulling up to a hotel after a long trip from the airport, to a crackhead trying to pretend to be valet parking!!!! Then, a hooker walking in and out of the lobby. Definitely left a bad taste in my mouth about Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: Great service!!!! Joseph B. was very helpful finding us a restaurant that was open on Easter Sunday! We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurita27
Reviews.Content: I will recommend all my friends & family to stay here best service ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Crowne Plaza Hotel and I was very impressed with the young man at the front desk named Joseph. He was very cordial in his greeting and helpful in answering any questions that I had about my stay at his hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable. I will gladly stay at a Crowne Plaza hotel in my future travels and I can highly recommend everyone to else to stay there also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ray W
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Christina, who made the stay enjoyable - she understands the meaning of Customer Service. Hotel was OK, not upper class, but overall a good bet. Restaurant was good - food was very good, but slow service. 20% off coupon was good, but only good for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: JWL_12
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank mr Joseph B. for his very good advise and hospitality. We also want to thank the Shuttle Car driver. He took us to a very good Restaurant. Very friendly!! .

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fantastic breakfast and value”
Reviews.Author: fred c
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was exceptional in accommodating our requests for parking an over-sized vehicle, extra bedding, breakfasts, and courtesy shuttles. Specifically Teri and Joseph B at the front desk, and Billy the shuttle driver. Breakfast was great, clean and quiet rooms. Price seemed great for a downtown hotel. I hope the special service was not only extended to us because of our platinum priority club status.

Reviews.Title: “Employee of the Month”
Reviews.Author: Crystal L
Reviews.Content: After arriving at 7:00am for a conference, we discovered that we had reservations at a hotel 10 miles away. Joseph B. eagerly assisted us in locating an available room onsite. He truly made our stay and experience wonderful! Thanks Joseph B! :-) Crystal Leon

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Heidi G
Reviews.Content: Joseph B was willing to help us out and very accommodating! We will definitely stay here again because of the customer service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Shelley C
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with this hotel. My friends and I enjoyed a night out in downtown and will be staying at this hotel in the future. The guy at the front desk was more than willing to help us out with everything!

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Antisha J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week. For the price it was horrible. The room was small and it was kinda dirty. The bathroom was like a closet and the tub wasn't very clean. It had a odor to it. Like an old hotel. I was charged $12.00 a day for parking and it was ridiculous. It was a bad choice we made. Ruined the 1st day of me and my daughters get a way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MeganN_13
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is an attractive hotel in a great location. It was within walking distance of many attractions in Dallas such as the aquarium and art museum, as well as many great restaurants. The service we received more than exceeded my expectations. As a hotel guest, you receive 20% off your meal at the restaurant off the lobby, and the food was delicious. The shuttle was more than willing to pick us up if we didn't want to walk back to the hotel at night, but what made my stay especially memorable was Joseph B. at the front desk. He was extremely accommodating and gave us suggestions as to what three 20-somethings could do in Dallas. He made my stay at the Crowne Plaza enjoyable and I would be back just because of him. The only complaints I have about the hotel are that the beds in our room were full, not queen, so there was a space issue with that. And the nightclub that they have on Thursday nights is way overpriced. Overall, my stay at this hotel was wonderful. If I ever go back to Dallas I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, probably seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen better days. Despite a very attractive lobby and an excellent location downtown, the rest of the hotel is fairly dated, and in some places dilapidated. It is, however, clean and the rooms are well equipped with all the usual amenities. The staff was polite and accommodating, but did not seem to go to awfully far out of their way to be helpful. None of the facilities were overly impressive either, but they were acceptable. All of this being said, the hotel is clean and the location is more than enough to make it appealing for people working or sightseeing downtown, but if you are looking for a memorable hotel, or a luxury experience I would keep looking. P.S. the hotel is not heatedâ€¦donâ€™t go jumping in it in the middle of March.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: gt1dreaming
Reviews.Content: Lobby and public area is very nice. The rooms need updating though. No pillow protectors. 1 Trash can in the whole room. The list goes on. From the lobby you have a Crowne Plaza, but from a rooms perspective, you have a Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mjtaylor409
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous!!! The rooms are spacious and have great views of downtown. The bed was great. I slept well. Great hd tv with lots of channels! CONS: Ironing board was old and missing cogs so it kept tilting over when I used it. I had to ask twice for another one. The bathtub was dirty I had to wash it. The bathroom and bathtub need to be repainted or retiled as the paint was peeling. The closet doors were off the hinges so they didn't slide to close properly. I am not picky so overall I would stay here again. I can tell that they have renovated most of the hotel and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for single female”
Reviews.Author: mercynurse62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a concert @ American Air Center. Room was very nice, clean, quiet, good quality linens for bed. Although the towels were nice and clean-not very soft. Intended to take Dart to concert and discovered to my delight that they have a shuttle for a 3 mile radius-shuttled to door and picked back up @ same. Staff was all very helpful and pleasant even though they were busy. I enjoy Dallas and attend events several times a year. As a female traveling alone, I can stay here, be safe and use their shuttle service to get around...what's not to love?!

Reviews.Title: “It's age does not show...”
Reviews.Author: Signore_Colomo
Reviews.Content: Very well located, friendly staff and a nice room, makes this hotel a good choice for staying. It is also very near the AA Center, and the Opera House. It is also four block away from Houston Street and the Conely Park. And if you are in bussiness, the light train station it's just a block away!. The only thing is that room is not so very quiet, may be the fenesteration need to be improved to match the room quality.

Reviews.Title: “By far, my worst hotel experience EVER.”
Reviews.Author: wheresthewine76051
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for it's close proximity by rail to American Airlines Center for a concert. My room was adjacent to the ice maker, vending machines and housekeeping closet, and around the corner from the elevators. It was so loud, I asked to be moved. The second room was even WORSE, so I remained in the original room. The nightclub downstairs caters to an 'interesting' crowd of drunken hellraisers. Upon returning from the concert, the lobby was full of women dressed like hookers (literally) in micro short skirts and revealing tops (all the women were overweight, so don't get excited guys), while the men were drunk and boisterous. The elevator to the rooms is the same elevator as to the parking garage, so on my way up, I shared an elevator with 5 drunk men who had just been thrown out of the bar for fighting. I feared for my safety. Absolutely TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: beadbo
Reviews.Content: Front desk went beyond my expections! Staff was very kind to my family. My child left her stuff dog in the room, the staff contacted me before we even knew!

Reviews.Title: “OK!”
Reviews.Author: TheSteck
Reviews.Content: Good location for downtown Dallas. Walk to Elm Street, see the Plaza. Big praise to Ingrid at front desk for sorting out a few issues very quickly and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, everything else is meh”
Reviews.Author: greenfish_in_FL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot -- within walking distance of the convention center, great restaurants, JFK museum, and even the arts district if you don't mind a little longer walk. That said, the immediate neighborhood doesn't feel too safe after dark; I'd advise a taxi if you're travelling solo. For a hotel that averaged over $200/night with taxes & parking fees, we were disappointed in the quality of service. Bellhops & front desk staff were hard to come by. The cleaning crew was more like what you'd expect to find in a cheaper hotel -- room service trays left in the hallways for hours, alongside piles of housekeeping's dirty towels. The hotel bartender was the worst of it all -- she completely ignored anyone who didn't look like a single guy. Wear your fake moustache if you're a girl, hide your ring if you're a guy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed considering this was a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Sinag
Reviews.Content: The room I was assigned to adjoins another room through an inner door. Walls were so thin I could hear the TV and conversation in the other room. I called reception several times to complain and nothing was done. Outside my window there was a glass filled with cigarette stubs, obviously, left unchecked and not cleared away. As a Priority Club member, I got a welcome pack of nuts, water and free breakfast coupon. No other special treatment. My colleague and I wanted to watch a rodeo and we were recommended a dodgy can driver. Hmmm not much good thing to say except that the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, so so service”
Reviews.Author: EastKootenayVisitor
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Crowne Plaza Downtown Dallas, for it's value for money: good location adjacent to a DART stop. Within walking distance to all the major downtown sites: Sixth Floor Museum/Dealey Plaza, Convention Center, Arts District. Rooms are not luxurious but comfortable and clean. My one disappointment was that there really was no concierge and front desk did not seem to be helpful in some very basic questions on attractions etc.What the staff lacks in knowledge seems to be made up by their friendliness and enthusiasm. .Thrive restaurant has a good and inexpensive hot breakfast buffet, but I would recommend eating elsewhere for dinner: the food was okay but nothing special. Lots of choices nearby. I also had trouble with the shower....it never seemed to get hot enough. All in all it is not as glamorous as the new Omni or the nearby Magnolia, etc but for a good bed at a reasonable price, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly.... NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: I am from Dallas, but I stayed at this hotel for New Years Eve so that I wouldn't have to worry about driving home after a night out. When I checked in, I was placed on a floor that appeared to be under construction (the floors had plastic wrap on them in the hallway). This was supposed to be a special night out so I was surprised to see the construction. BUT, it wasn't too big of a deal so I let it go. Afterwards, we came home early morning to find that the elevators were broken. The firemen and police had surrounded the lobby. Long story short, we were forced to walk up 19 flights of stairs because our room was on the 19th floor. Keep in mind, we were in no condition to to be walking up 19 flights of staircase, especially in a nice dress and heels. Half way through, I took my heels off. The next morning I woke up with blisters on my feet. I know it wasn't the heels creating blisters because I wear them all the time, and have never had blisters from them. I am not one to complain but when I went to the front desk to get a lower discount, they took a measly $15 off my rate... My rate was originally $129. So I still had to spend over $100 for an awful stay. I thought it would have been fair to make my rate an even $100 but according the the FRONT DESK MANAGER - MANNY, that's all that they can do for me. This was a SLAP IN THE FACE. It's obvious that they truly DON'T CARE about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Room was adequate but bathroom needs work”
Reviews.Author: Yvette S
Reviews.Content: For the price, we were happy with the room, but the bathroom needed work: 1. The toilet sealer cap needed to be replaced...we could hear the water running on and off all night. 2. The tub needed to be redone....it felt like it was re-glazed but they left a rough surface on the bottom of the tub....which makes it uncomfortable for a toddler's behind when taking a bath. 3. The shower walls had mold in the grout....time to re-tile. 4. The shower head was cranked so tight you couldn't adjust it and it had a leak that sprayed all over the bathroom if you didn't put a wash cloth over it. Front desk was polite and the only reason why we checked out, was to inform them of all the needed repairs. We didn't expect anything in return, but they did offer a free breakfast, but we had eaten already. They didn't offer anything at this point. Hotel is pet friendly, but they charge $25, so we had our dog sleep in the covered parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Nicolee H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. I enjoyed it. The parking is very tight and the logistics of the hotel are different; however, the room service was good and staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better....”
Reviews.Author: Grettasmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend on the White Rock Lake Marathon. It was $160 for 2 night/2 people. It's a nice hotel, OK area ( sits next to large bus stop and Dart system) and easy access to the Amtrak/Union station, walkable distance. There is a free shuttle provided any place within a 3 mile radius. However, the driver was unprofessional in dropping hints for a tip! Our room was small:no bathroom ventilation, dark stains on both the bed sham and skirt. The hotel is not environmentally friendly, no recycling measures in place, despite 20 floors and a club/restaurant on site? This is the 21st century and "green times"! That really irked me and would affect my staying there again! Upon check in I was not provided an overview of amenities, like the fitness center being on the 9th floor. However, we were provided a microwave/fridge upon request. Step it up on the cleanliness and environmental awareness, Crowne Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Get Away for A Good Price...”
Reviews.Author: bobmarleys_sista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in September 2011. We went for a concert and a quick get away. I found the Crowne Plaza online and thought it was a great deal and in an ideal location for all the things we wanted to do. The room was nice and all the staff was very friendly. There were three things that I didn't like about the hotel. First we were told that there was a shuttle service but it never came to pick my husband and I up. Not a real big deal since we just drove our car or walked. The second thing was that there is a night club that is open to the public and the bouncers kind of bombard you when you get off the elevator. And the third thing was that the waitresses in the hotel were not very attentive to their customers. All in all we like the hotel. It was very close to restaurants and sight seeing, and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel! No question about it!”
Reviews.Author: Christian A
Reviews.Content: Last year we drove from Minneapolis down to New Orleans. We chose to visit Dallas on the way, we are from Denmark and we really wanted to see some of the bigger cities in Texas, and having stayed at several other Crowne Plaza locations during our trips to the states, we ended up choosing Crowne Plaza Dallas Downtown, while in town. We had read a fair share of bad reviews inhere, but usually we find that Crowne Plaza is a pretty pleasant experience overall, so we decided to give it a go. The hotel has recently been renovated, so the decor and the rooms are really really nice. Nice big rooms, most of them has a great view of the downtown skyline, which is a pretty big deal in Dallas, where the skyline is among the most impressive in America. The room we stayed in had a nice big LG flatscreen, a small fridge and amazing beds. The lobby is pretty impressive and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Dallas, you can walk to most of the restaurants as well as most of the historic landmarks. At night I would recommend that you do not walk around in the area, as it is pretty much deserted, aside from the occasional homeless people you will see here and there. This is primarily due to the fact that the downtown area, in general, pretty much becomes a ghost town outside of business hours. However the two main reasons for choosing this hotel for your next Dallas stay are the following: 1: It has an absolutely AMAZING pool on the ninth floor, I seem to remember it being on the ninth floor, but I might be mistaking. Anyway you will fall in love with this "rooftop" pool immediately, it has the most breathtaking view of the downtown area you could possibly ask for. The hotel is located right across the street from the Bank of America" skyscraper, which at night is bathed in green neon lighting, it looks just stunning when you are up at the pool in the evening, Lying in the water at night looking at all those amazing futuristic steel and glass skyscrapers, which Dallas has an abundance of, while the airplanes from Southwest Airlines comes cruising by, is an amazing experience. The only I donÂ´t get about the pool is the lack of an outside bar, it would be awesome to enjoy a bear or a drink up there, while relaxing and enjoying the view. 2: Alex! Yeah it might sound weird, I know, but Crowne Plaza in Dallas has the most helpful guy in America as part of their staff. That guy will bend over backwards in order for you to have the most pleasant experience while in the city. We felt so appreciated from the moment we got there because of him, and he made sure we knew where to go for a great meal, what to see in the city and what to avoid. He insisted on carrying our luggage, drive us around the city in the hotel van and he made sure we felt extremely welcome every time we came home from sightseeing or something else - He is truly a great representative of the Crowne Plaza chain as well as Dallas itself - Nothing less! If we are ever in Dallas again, we will definitely be back! Loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, and great location for the West End.”
Reviews.Author: MrSportsnut
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Dallas for a guys weekend and to catch the Cowboys game. Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights. Now I should say that I don't complain about too much when I'm staying at a 3-4 star hotel, especially if I get the room at a good price (which we did). Overall, the hotel should meet all your needs for a comfortable stay. The staff is friendly, and the service at the front desk was fast. About the rooms... I stayed in a corner room, that according to my friends staying in other rooms, was a little larger than theirs. The room has plenty of closet and drawer space for 2 people. I found the bed comfortable (slightly firm), and there are enough pillows to invite the Cowboy Cheerleaders over for a battle (attempts at holding this event were unsuccessful). The bathroom is a little small, but not a big deal. The WiFi in the room worked just fine. The only negative I found is with the heating/AC unit. It makes a loud sound when it kicks on, and is a little louder than some people will like. As far as the location... you are pretty much downtown, so the streets around the hotel get deserted in the evening and on weekends. But that doesn't mean there is nothing to do. There is a club in the hotel that gets busy on Friday and Saturday. We had the most fun out at the West End and at the Ten Sports Grill on Main St. On the West End, you should check out Dick's Last Resort. Fun spot (maybe not the place for church groups to go wind down after reading Scripture). Lots of other places to imbibe and consume various dead animals (lots of steakhouses surprisingly). We went to the Ten Sports Grill a couple of times to catch some football, and they have a pretty good menu there. The bucket of wings is worth buying. Ask for Jackie to serve you and tell her that her husband says hi. The only things that keep me from rated the hotel a 5 is that for some, they might not like the location (I forgot to mention that the JFK Memorial is also a short walk away), and some people might find the AC loud. If they had a 4.5, I would rate the hotel that.

Reviews.Title: “Good bed, LOUD A/C, tiny bathroom. A bit iffy in spots.”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_Pow
Reviews.Content: First, the good points: 1) Check in was fast, friendly, professional. 2) Room was clean. Bed was comfy, lots of pillows. Decent (if a bit small) for price. 3) Good downtown Dallas location. Easy walking distance to several decent bars & restaurants (Sonny Bryans Smokehouse, TGI Fridays, Hofbrau Steaks, YO Ranch Steakhouse, etc). 4) Friendly, helpful hotel staff. 5) Good water pressure, nice shower. 6) In-room fridge that was ice cold at check-in! 7) Attentive housekeeping in-room. 8) Very close to DART & bus stops. Some people like this. Some probably find this disconcerting (due to the large amount of people waiting, some panhandling). We were out walking around both nights: no problems. We noticed a large police presence at night. 9) Key for elevator is a nice security touch. 10) Close to historic West End tourist attractions http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_End_Historic_District_(Dallas,_Texas) The iffy: 1) Loud AC system. The system clonked loudly each time it cycled on and off, and vibrated oddly. Extremely HOT in the hallway (almost sauna like). 2) Very small bathroom. The vanity/sink area was so small I had to put a towel on the floor and use the toilet seat due to lack of vanity space. 3) Some problems with housekeeping OUTSIDE the room (food trays left in the hall more than one day). 4) Problems with parking gate cards not working. Attendant was less than helpful. 5) Breakfast was $15.00 for a Belgian waffle & coffee. This did not taste like a fresh waffle; it looked, felt and tasted frozen and it came with one sad sliced Strawberry. Pretty sad even for a Crowne Plaza. Starbucks is across the street, in the Bank of America building, down the escalator, behind the CVS if you want REAL coffee. YO Ranch Steakhouse (2 blocks down and 2 blocks over) is GREAT! Had a wonderful meal here: a mixed grill of venison, quail and buffalo -- wow! Fabulous! Great wine... superior service. Treat yourself to a wonderful meal at YO Ranch Steakhouse. Overall: Decent hotel for the price. The bed was comfy, plenty of pillows, good shower. Would have to think twice about staying here again unless I specifically needed to be in this area. Be warned: It is VERY loud at night, lots of car & truck noise, DART, buses & sirens. We were on 15th floor and it was still VERY loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, look out for the disco!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: When you book into a central Crowne Plaza you don't expect the hotel bar to become a nightclub while you are out at dinner. That's what happens here on a Friday and Saturday night - the two days I was staying. Overall this would make little difference, apart from I don't recommend popping back for a quick drink in the only bar there after 10. The problem is that if you are not a clubber you will not appreciate the groups of youngsters who head back to their room after enjoying the club. In fairness the noise did not last long and the hotel is comfortable and well located close to the 6th floor museum and the West End restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Locaion”
Reviews.Author: NattoMatto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel over all, however the location was a bit sketchy. The hotel is downtown, and the neighborhood is not bad, but it set my spider sense tingling while driving there in the later evening. Parking was an additional $12 to the cost of the room. Not bad, considering it is a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ms Fate”
Reviews.Author: MsF4G
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Crown Plaza Downtown Dallas was somewhat pleasant. The staff was very courteous, friendly and for the most part very accommodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable. However it was the last few hours prior to checkout that was very disappointing. On the morning of checkout I encountered a problem with the room entry pad that resulted in being locked out of my room for almost 30 minutes as the battery pack on the door malfunctioned. I contacted the front desk at least twice and addressed the issue to management as I waited for maintenance to arrive. I was left with a sense that management was not overly concerned with the length of time it took to fix the problem not to mention being locked out for at least 30 minutes. The housekeeping supervisor was very apologetic and waited with me until maintenance arrived. I did not receive any respond from the hotel Manager on Duty nor a follow-up to see if the problem was resolved. Up until that point the overall experience was good; however the latter experience managed to overshadow the prior.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and customer service”
Reviews.Author: MsDMV
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel, in a great loaction, in the heart of Downtown Dallas, the Crowne is the place to stay. It is very close to great shopping and dining. The staff is courteous, helpful and flexible. I stay at the Crowne because of the great service and staff. The rooms are clean and have a beautiful view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Getaway”
Reviews.Author: shirleyeSheffieldUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in September and found it excellent both times. The recpetion staff were very friendly and most helpful with directions. The cleaning staff were really nice and the rooms exceptionally clean. The bar area is good and the staff efficient. The restaurant staff were also good. The only thing I would have liked is a change of the menu. There wasn't much choice and as we ate in every night, and me not eating meat, I occasionally had to duplicate my choice. The food was very good but the portions were huge. We could only ever eat about half of the amount, even though we'd asked for smaller portions. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice. Brilliant rooftop pool, if a little cold! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping was unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Lex9997
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few months ago. The staff was friendly and the service was acceptable. I can tell they have put at least some effort into updating the lobby and main floor facilities of what is obviously an older building. However, I did not feel that the rooms were clean. They were dank and dark to say the least. The housekeeping staff left a rag, which had obviously been used to clean every dirt toilet on the whole floor, on top of my makeup bag. I typically stay at very modestly priced hotels, many of which cost less than this one, and I can honestly say this is the second or third most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in. I also found a bug of some sort crawling on me when I returned home. I realized only recently after seeing a special on tv, that it may have been a bed bug, which is why I am just now writing a review. Luckily, I stored my luggage in the basement and haven't touched it since, and I washed my clothes immediately, so it hasn't turned into problem, but I shutter at the thought of what could have happened, especially considering my ignorance of what bed bugs look like. Now I know and I'll not take a risk like this again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: renesio
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the many favorable reviews. We were not disappointed at all. Check in was quick and friendly. Our requested non smoking room was granted. It was on the 14th floor which is designated as a non smoking floor. Initially had problems with the room wifi but eventually got thru. Very convenient. The downtown location was nice but it is obvious that this property had seen better days. Inspire of this handicap, the rooms are cleaned so well and the amenities, towels, and the beddings were all excellent. The breakfast buffet was good. Will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza unable to hold it's crown”
Reviews.Author: lulys67
Reviews.Content: Crown Plaza Downtown Dallas is convenient for the business traveler who won't put a lot of emphasis on the decor or charmed. I stayed 6 nights at the hotel and was somewhat disappointed with the decor and the maintenance. The hotel needs to be upgraded and needs more action in the hotel...toooooo quiet and deserted for my taste. The room had a wet cRpet when I walked in...to tire to change to another room. The room was ok but had a noisy fridge. It was nice to have a microwave and coffee maker but no coffee available. You must have your hotel key in order to get on the elevator which I thought it was a good security feature but then it made me wonder of the surroundings.there are plenty of fast food restaurants except on sunday where everything is close. The hotel offers a wonderful buffet I truly re omens it. Gym equipment needs updating like the rest of the hotel. Staff is super nice but location is questionable. It's approximate 50 follRs taxi ride from dew airport but shuttle is less. It's 17 to retune from hotel to airport using super shuttle service...overall...hotel needs. Little tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Trial”
Reviews.Author: Jack W
Reviews.Content: I spent 12 long day here while representing clients in a trial at the courthouse across the street. the location was extremely convenient and the amenities were all a stressed lawyer could hope for while living out of a hotel room while in trial.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza - Excellent Lodging and Service”
Reviews.Author: Bary W
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 1 night stay. They allowed me to early checkin and then provided a Priority Member gift and breakfast coupon. Ingrid, the receptionist, was very cordial and nice. We definitely come back for another stay. Bary

Reviews.Title: “Fun Local Get Away”
Reviews.Author: jrappelman
Reviews.Content: Great location and a great staff to accompany it! Although we live only 10 miles away from Downtown, the atmosphere at the Crowne Plaza makes it feel as if you are on a weekend trip a thousand miles away. We chose this location becuase it offers some great amenities: Location, Nightlife and Restraunts. One of the great things about the club at the hotel was being able to get in for free and being able to take drinks back to the room. We will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: I thought the rooms were pretty cheap in price for any hotel in the area. This hotel was nice, lobby was clean, restaurant/bar was nice, and the rooms were nice. The rooms were a little older, but they were still nice and kept in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: From my greeting at the front door with bags to my room, to the friendly welcome and gift bag from Megan at the front desk, to my clean, inviting room and comfortable bed...my stay was wonderful and peaceful. Just what I needed. Although a loud party was being held at the hotel that night, Megan was quick to advise me and move me to the other side of the hotel. I was here on business and needed peace and quiet in my room...I was not disappointed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJCal
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here in Sept. We started out looking for budget accommodation in Fort Worth but with a convention in town all rates were quite high. Found a great rate $79 for this hotel on their website. A short walk from the greyhound bus station, check in was efficient and very friendly and our room was fantastic. Big King bed, spotless bathroom and widescreen TV. We had planned to stay just 1 night but extended our stay for 4 nights and did a couple of day trips from there. It's only 2 blocks to Market street where you will find restaurants and bars and less than a ten minute walk to JFK memorial and 6th floor muesum which is a must see! All the staff we met were smiley and friendly and seemed eager to help us. The hotel also has an outdoor pool on the 9th floor which we took advantage of, again kept clean with sun loungers and plenty of towels. Would def stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A good welcome from the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LuisGalindo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated, near the American Airlines Center, the rooms are nice and clean. The best of the hotel is their service, I was helped in the frontdesk upon check in by Megan and Ingrid, very kind and happy persons, makes you feel welcome. I recomend this hotel all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located and provided several necessary amenities that made my business trip enjoyable. The staff were very kind and accomodating throughout my stay there. I look forward to staying there on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: JULIE P
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this downtown hotel. It was very easy to access and close to the fun and interesting things in downtown Dallas. Loved the parking, too!

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired, much like the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sknovr
Reviews.Content: We selected this Crown Plaza based on our experience at another Crown Plaza in the Dallas area where we stayed on another vacation. A great illustration of how different two motels in the same chaincan be. This location is right in the center if Dallas which means lots of heavy traffic. Unless you need to be in the downtown area, this place is hardly worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL REALLY NEEDS AN UPDATE AS THE FURNITURE AND CARPET IS OLD AND REALLY NEEDS TO BE REPLACED”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Taxi from the airport to hotel approximately US$47. SECURITY: Good security as you have to use your key card to go to your floor level. There were large in room safes - big enough to accommodate a laptop. ROOMS: Rooms really needed an update as the furniture was at least 40 years old and the carpet was very old and not up to the Crown Plaza standard. We had a balcony suite but the door had no latch so you could not lock it. There was no outdoor furniture on the balcony and the balcony area was grubby with a bare concrete floor (untiled) which needed a really good clean up and you could not sit out there because there was nowhere to sit. The fridge did not work properly as any milk or water you placed in there became frozen solid. The coffee machine in the room did not work - we reported it to housekeeping but nothing was done to fix anything. At $320 per night including taxes and breakfast we expected better as the suite was very dated and needed new carpet and furniture. BREAKFAST: Approximately US$11 per person for the buffett breakfast which consisted of cereal, fruit, scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, bread/buns and tea/coffee. Probably the same as you would expect at a Holiday Inn Express so not that exciting but the price was right if you do not have breakfast included. INTERNET: Good in room WiFi connection and no problems connecting. CLUB ROOM/FLOOR: There is no Club Room at this hotel but every Wednesday night they have alcoholic welcome drinks and snacks for Priority Club members from 5pm to 7pm. POSITION: Good position and about a 15 minute walk to the 6th Floor Book Depository JFK tour. Good selection of restaurants are within walking distance to the hotel. There is a CVS supermarket just behind the hotel that has a good selection of food products including wine by the bottle at good prices. They do not sell any fresh fruit. A free hotel shuttle van is available for guests to go to shopping or restaurants within a 3 mile radius. TOURS: There are really no tour operators and you really have to arrange your own sightseeing which is a little difficult if you do not have a vehicle. Forth Worth is definitely worth the trip - you can walk to Union Station (about 20 minutes from the hotel) or take the hotel free shuttle and catch the train to Fort Worth Stockyards (about $10 for a day pass that will include most bus trips). Train trip is about 1 hour. When you arrive at Fort Worth you can take a free loop trip around town and include Sundance Square on Molly the Trolly - many choices to have lunch. The trolly will take you back to the rail station where you can catch a bus to The Stockyards which is a very quaint and unique area to spend a few hours wandering around the many shops/restaurants and visiting some of the museums unique to the area. Really enjoyed Fort Worth and the Stockyards except for the heat as the temperature was about 110F.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: misty c
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Downtown Dallas! The hotel staff were so amazing and awesome! The hotel is very clean and comfortable! Thank you Crowne Plaza for the experience of a lifetime!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: alliescot73
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the Crowne Plaza downtown Dallas. Location first of all was excellent just beside the train station and close to pubs and restaurants. Location was the main reason we decided on this hotel however I would have to say that the staff were excellent especially Alex who assisted with transport and ideas of where to go and Christopher in the restaurant/bar who took the time to speak with us about the area. Both made us feel that nothing was too much trouble for them. Excellent customer service!! Pool was on the 9th floor with views of the surrounding area. It was very quiet and most of the time we had the pool to ourselves. Only complaint is that on a Friday/Saturday night when the nightclub is on there is no area for residents to go and have a quiet drink in the hotel. However as everything else in the hotel was good just a very minor issue, If back in the Dallas area would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: My colleage and myself stayed at the Crowne Plaza downtown Dallas and foudn it well located comfortable and teh staff were very helpful will be back to stay next time we are working in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Carole H
Reviews.Content: Everything was so clean and new. The bar and restaurant were wonderful and the food was delicious. Service from all employees was outstanding. They made you feel very welcome and that you were important as a person

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business”
Reviews.Author: BrianG27
Reviews.Content: I was able to get work done after my client vists during the day efficiently in a very nice room. I met a customer for breakfast at the hotel. She enjoyed breakfast and we had a productive meeting. This hotel is centrally locate din downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Had A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Megan was very helpfull with directions of the area. The room was very clean, quit, and everyone was polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mark s
Reviews.Content: After being in the room 10 - 15 minutes I received a call just making sure if I needed anything. Class act!

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoy this hotel. Stay here whenever in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: william L
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and friendly staff...Room has a beautiful view and is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Suprize”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: The service was great from the front desk to the lounge. The room was very nice and comfortable. The locations was walking distance to night life in Dallas, but the bar and pool were hopping. I was in town for business but it made the trip more like a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Kind, helpful staff and a comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kristy C
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about this hotel given some of the previous reviews that I have read but I am a Platinum Priority Club member and wanted to give it a try. I was so pleased!! Not only did I stay here but our larger team used the facilities for a 4-day meeting. All of the meeting space was just perfect. We used several rooms in the Plaza section. My room and the entire hotel decor was lovely. I really enjoyed the lobby area as well. The location was great and there were many fabulous places to eat and shop nearby. The staff went out of the way to be super kind and helpful. I am very grateful to Dale with IT/Audio for his expert help and to Ingrid for making my check-out experience top notch. The room was a little warm for me but given the time of year and the heat, I simply closed the curtains and that helped. The 9th floor, outdoor pool was WONDERFUL, especially at night. The view is spectacular and it is just fun to be on a roof-top pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma R
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. I loved the breakfast and lunch buffet. The entire staff at the hotel was very pleasant. I look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility; very friendly staff; I will return; Ingrid was very helpful at check in.”
Reviews.Author: patrick m
Reviews.Content: Details are very important; it is the little things that matter. The beer and chocolates were a very nice surprise and touch; demonstrates that you care.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: weluvourpuppies
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a weekend getaway in Dallas. Hotel was perfect. Very clean, staff was so friendly and welcoming especially Megan. Location was within walking distance to anywhere we wanted to go. We will definetly go back in the future for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: steve m
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, the hotel receptionist were courtesy and responded to my requests. Great view of the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with my stay at the Crown Plaza. The location was convenient to all parts of downtown Dallas. The staff bent over backwards to make sure I was completely satisfied. I am eagerly awaiting my next trip to Dallas so that I can return to the Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, and great elite recognition!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: The thing that impressed me most about this Crowne Plaza is their friendly service. It seems that everyone love what they do and are eager to please the guests. The PC elite recognition was also very good! As a platinum member I received a chocolate cowboy boot filled with pecans, as well as 2 Lone Star beers delivered to my door. Breakfast was also comped for Plats too! The hotel location is great, within walking distance of some great bars and restaurants. The rooms are updated and are clean. The parking garage is a little tight., but that's to be expected in downtown locations. If I have to stay in downtown Dallas again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: jskippyk
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable and the rooms were great. For turndown service I was even given a molded cowboy boot chocolate that was delicious. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: bnoedel
Reviews.Content: Stayed three weeks at the Crowne Plaza Dallas Downtown for training at a nearby office building. The hotel is old and in need of major renovations. I had multiple issues with air conditioning in the room. Also, the housekeeping failed to clean and restock amenities in the room several times during my stay. The front desk staff and restaurant staff were friendly and professional, however the breakfast buffet was horrible. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable home away from home..”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper907
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in the perfect location in downtown Dallas for my business trip. Room had great air conditioning which was a must have because of the outside tempatures exceeding 100 degrees every day. Hotel had ample elevators for the size that were able to keep up with the demand of the convention that was going on. Hotel had provided ocassional happy hour for guests that were registered with the rewards points program. Pool is located outside on the 9th floor and was very relaxing in the afternoons. Hotel is located next to light rail system which made it easy to travel to numerous locations where entertainment could be found.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility”
Reviews.Author: djfred49
Reviews.Content: Everything you would need is in this hotel. It is located in a very easy to navigate area. Lots of restaurants close to shopping and close to the Dallas Convention Center. It is also right around the corner from the West End and West End Transfer station. Here you can get on the free local trains or catch the bus. Very happy with this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mds96
Reviews.Content: From the start, everyone was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing”
Reviews.Author: adityajayam
Reviews.Content: The trip was great and the place has a great breakfast area...

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, and keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Josehdz
Reviews.Content: This is my third week staying here. It's a close walk to the client site. The rooms are nice, and decently quiet. The pool is nice (too bad I don't get home until dark). The staff are friendly, and the food at the restaurant is good. All in all if your in town on business its pretty economical for the company.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Dallas. Plan ahead, Stay here if you are in Downtown Dallas or having meeting there.”
Reviews.Author: Stochasticman
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, this is not a brand new hotel. BUT, The staff is 5 Star, From Megan (and the others) at the front desk, throughout the various interactions with staff, it's been a long time since I've had a staff and hotel practices work so hard to make sure everything was a close to perfect as they could make it. The Staff and accommodations at this hotel Are OUTSTANDING. After 25 years of traveling all over the world and staying in many of the highest rated hotels, I have become of fan of no frills, but good quality hotels and seldom stay at full service hotels. My stay here was only a result of attending a conference and having an overnight meeting. I intended to stay one night and get out of Dallas. However, from Megan at the front dest, to housekeeping, to the room having adequate plug ins etc. This was such a great stay, I rebooked another night and had my other associate stay at the hotel. I didn't know that US hotels wee capable of this level of service and delight. Hotels are brick and mortar, the staff is what makes it. This hotel staff is on par with the Shangri La Singapore in terms of attitude and little touches. GOOD JOB, Dallas Crown Plaza

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: aorosia
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice rooms, good location... I'll be back in my next visit

Reviews.Title: “This time, a personal choice”
Reviews.Author: DeSotoIron
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular Crowne Plaza numerous times because it is very near my company's business office in Dallas and the property is one of my company's preferred hotels. When my wife and I vacationed in Dallas this year, I chose to stay at the same Crowne Plaza for personal reasons. We enjoyed the same level of care and service I had received on previous business visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay looking to stay again”
Reviews.Author: excellantrip
Reviews.Content: Staff excellent, room was clean to no end. I would reccommend this hotel chain to any and everyone i know. looking to stay again. please keep up the Excellent Excellent work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: thx_188
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was warmly greeted by the staff. I got to my room within 15 minutes had a snack tray and two Lone Stars delivered free of charge. All week long the breakfast was very good and so we the other meals I had at the hotel. The housekeeping staff asked if I had a good stay when I was leaving. The desk staff inquired about how the stay had been. All in all a great experience at this hotel. Jadie Freeman

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_B14
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a couple free days and chosed this hotel mainly for its location and I wasn't disappointed. As a Priority Reward member, I received a free treat upon check-in and a coupon for a free buffet breakfast. That free breakfast was the only time I went to the hotel restaurant, so I can't really judge how good it is. Breakfast was good though, with a mix of cold dishes and the option of getting something warm cooked for you. Room was clean and large enough to accomodate a couple without any problem (I was alone though) with all the amenities you'd expect from an hotel near a business center. Speaking of the latter, you have to known that there's not many people living in downtown Dallas, so don't be surprise if you find many shops and smaller restaurants to be close after 6PM. Hotel right next to the DART West End Station and Transit area which is very convient if you don't have access to a car during your stay. Riding DART is cheap (4$US for a day pass) and it's very reliable. You're also a few minutes away from the West End Historic District that host a fair amount of restaurants. A 10 minutes walk will bring you to a more crowded section of the Main Street for another choice of restaurants. The hotel is also at walking distance from the JFK Memorial and Museum and from a Tourist office. I'm not sure what was wrong with my device, but I couldn't access the hotel wi-fi service in my room. I used the small business center and it was more enough for what I needed even though that room was icy cold. Thumbs up for the desk staff too, they were all very friendly and pro-active with every customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: NathanK429
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional and the hotel was extremely comfortable. This is extremely important when traveling 3-4 days every week. I would recommend this hotel to others and look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLinker
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the hotel was second to none. I will be back. Matt Linker

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and accommodations made our stay wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ronallen9
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Dallas from L.A. with 15 teenage football players and six adults, the last thing we wanted to do was waste time checking in. From the minute we got there we were made to feel like the only customers that existed. They gave us a lot of useful complimentary gifts and handled our most difficult requests with a smile. The rooms were very nice and clean. Overall the hotel gets my recommendation to anyone traveling to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “I got first class treatment, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MsDMV
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the hotel is superior. The staff made me feel comfortable and accomodated me as much as possible. The rooms and the facilities were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great DNTWN Location”
Reviews.Author: DonMiguel50
Reviews.Content: This visit exceeded our expectations. Professional, accomodating staff. The pool was on the 9th floor roof and offered a great view of the West End, wich is walking distance, and the downtown skyscrappers. The light rail system is right outside the hotel with access to all the hot spots. The room was updated with LCD TV and very comfortable bed. We were also impressed by the staff and dining room, not to mention the quality of the breakfast buffet. We will definately make this our downtown place to stay when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel in Dallas, TX”
Reviews.Author: 19charlie76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a few nights at the Crowne Plaza Hotel in downtown Dallas. I was extremely impressed with the property, service, and associates. One reason other then being a priority club member that I chose this property was its location. It is located in downtown and has easy access to all the freeways. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with modern amenities (plush bed, flat panel TV, rooftop pool with a view). The property also has a shuttle for traveling within the downtown facility. Seasoned traveler.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definetly be back!”
Reviews.Author: GenesisMonic
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was excellent and very helpful, from when we checked in until we left. The hotel was very easy to find and is located in the heart of downtown Dallas. Minutes away from American Airline Center, restaurants, bars, clubs, and major highways. The pool is on the roof, it was very clean as well as the room. We were extremely satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for Newly Weds”
Reviews.Author: Sarakgole
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza offers an amazing hotel experience. The staff were very helpful and catered to our every need. We just got married and could not have asked for a better place. Anytime we are in Dallas we will most definitely be staying at Crowne Plaza. The breakfast buffet is excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ehutut
Reviews.Content: Upon check in the front desk agent was courteous and asked how my trip was and let me know about the amenities of the hotel and the area. he recommended Hofbrau Steaks for a good meal and fun southern hospitality - I didn't want anything fancy. The parking was convenient and did not break the bank like most downtown hotels these days. My room was on the 15th floor overlooking the rooftop pool and uptown Dallas! the sleep amenity was great offering a blindfold, ear plugs and pillow spray. I stayed for 2 nights and the staff remembered my name and aske dhow dinner was. Teh business center was adequate and the restaurant had a really cool decor - kind of Moroccan with dark reds and innovative lighting! I was attendinga meeting at a nearby office and this was the perfect hotel - not too big, gerat amenities and recently openend - renovated. I would recommend for families, business travel or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise and value”
Reviews.Author: DML823
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out I have never had such a pleasant stay at such a great price. The room was comfortable, the view was great, the club was relaxing and comfortable and the restaurant was outstanding. I was greeted with a smile by what I found throughout my stay to be an efficient and friendly desk syaff. To my surpirse was told that the hotel was sorry but they were not able to upgrade me as normal with my Priority Club status, and then handed bonus points to make up for it. I walked into the room to find the A/C already turned down and the room cool (70 degrees on a 98 degree day) with molded chocolates and dipped stawberrys sitting on the table along with two true Texas Lone star beers as a welcoming gift. The bed was comfortable, the wireless internet had a strong signal, and did I mention the room was cool! I visit Dallas on business frequently and from now on this is my Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get-away weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dabney1982
Reviews.Content: The serivce at the front desk of the hotel was easily the best service I have ever recieved on a vacation. We had requested to change rooms multiple times and the staff was extremely helpful accomadating our requests. The pool and night club access was a bonus and helped satisfy our needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel simply for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and efficient business travel location”
Reviews.Author: Deborah058
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June as a IHG Priority club member and got total VIP treatment. Loved this Crowne Plaza for a few reasons: 1. Very professional, hospitable and helpful front desk staff. 2. Nice welcome gift bag with a water bottle (great after my long flight) and a little Texan treat 3. Clean rooms, comfy sheets 4. Has a pool and workout facility that other people were actually using!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and superior service”
Reviews.Author: Mrsweeks22
Reviews.Content: The check in process was quick and friendly. We walked to our favorite downtown restaurant for dinner. Upon returning to our room, we determined the pillows were down feathers which husband is allergic. Called front desk and within 5 minutes someone was there to exchange. Service in restaurant was friendly. Check out was fast & easy. Will be back in October for OU-TX game.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Nealla831
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at the Crowne Plaza, Downtown Dallas to be exceptionally friendly, efficient, and helpful. During a recent stay, I discovered I had left home without a piece of medical equipment I needed and the staff was so kind while helping me to successfully locate the part at 6:30 PM on a Friday night. From calling a cab to offering their advice on local delivery restaurants, they went above and beyond to make sure my stay was a pleasant one. The room was very clean, and abundant pillows were provided as well as lavender scented linen spray. Heaven. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Treated poorly, can't escape parking charge”
Reviews.Author: bcbennett
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was given the handicapped room. I went back downstairs and said, "I don't want the handicapped room; please give me another." They gave me a tiny corner room that was obviously the runt of the floor. I believe they don't appreciate prepaid discount bookers. Also, parking is 12.00 per day--good luck finding anywhere else to park. Should be included in the description of the rate.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: VryHapyCmpr
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the breakfast is the best. The dinning is excellent. Everyone bends over backwards to help and they made my stay very enjoyable. I will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service! Will always stay here when in Dallas!!”
Reviews.Author: cowgirlmmm1
Reviews.Content: I travel to this hotel multiple times a year for business. The entire staff is always friendly and happy to see me. The banquet staff (for meetings at hotel) is attentive. The food is excellent - I've never had anything bad when dining at the hotel. The rooms are comfortable with great views of Downtown. There is a rooftop pool with excellent view as well. The nightclub is growing in popularity and great bartenders! Best thing: The great customer service! Bad thing: when dining at hotel, it take the food a lil while to come out, but I found out it's because they cook the food to order - but well worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: bstevanson
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Crowne Plaza Dallas Downtown was great in many ways--location was perfect, rate was excellent and service was top notch. I would recommend this hotel to any group needing a downtown location for an event or for a vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times were had!”
Reviews.Author: acetcc
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendly staff! Met all my requests and very helpful! My wife and I will stay here everytime we come back to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Vanya_11
Reviews.Content: I was on business for a week in Dallas and stayed at the Downtown Dallas Crowne Plaza. Even though I had originally planned to stay at another hotel, I was glad that I ended up at the Crowne Plaza. The location was perfect as I had to spend time in various locations downtown as well as other parts of Dallas. The hotel is right around the corner from the DART light rail stop which is very useful and also close to several major freeways that allow access to all parts of the Metroplex. But the best part was the friendly helpful staff at this property: from the front desk personnel to the cleaning staff and even the staff member who came up right away to fix some problem with the TV. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Dallas on business.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: Euanm
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after 11 pm to find our pre-paid reservation was not recorded, the hotel completely full and down town Dallas booked out with five conventions. The desk clerk found a show room for us but the beds had been stripped and housekeeping had gone home for the night.. Not to be deterred he arrived at the room with bedding in hand and made up the beds. We were also offered complimentary breakfasts and a late check out the next day as compensation. The hotel would not accept payment saying it would sort out the problem itself with the booking agency. That's what I call service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tex_MarlowOK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was very friendly, they offered suggestions for getting around and offered maps without having to ask for one. They let us leave the truck in their parking garage even after checkout since we were staying in the area. Awesome "welcome" package for Priority Club Members: Lone Star, the National Beer of Texas, was included. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Jumpchic
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of downtown Dallas, with great access to the West End and numerous fine restaurants. Great business meeting facilities and service. Front desk was very friendly and helpful with any inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CoachEAE
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel every other month for the past six months and have had great experiences every time. This is a great hotel to hold a conference. The food is exceptional, the stafff is very friendly,, and the bar is a great place to relax. The rooms are high quality, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Satisfied with room, food, and service!”
Reviews.Author: mike_lange
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took my 13 year old daughter and her best friend to see the Broadway Show "Billy Elliott" The service by the staff was excellent! The room was very comfortable and the food in the restaurant was great!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: larsen55599
Reviews.Content: Had a two-night stay at the Crowne Plaza Dallas Downtown hotel where I attended a conference and conducted business meeting. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with parking, making a restaurant recommendation and making dinner reservations, giving directions to downtown events, finding meeting locations, computer challenges, and service in the hotel restaurant was excellent. Food was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to stay in Downtown, Dallas”
Reviews.Author: discoaudra
Reviews.Content: The staff is so friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful inside and out, great pool, bar,nightclub, excellent food and service. The rooms are big and very nice, with very comfortable beds . The security is wondeful! I can not say enough about how great it is for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: cmg1205
Reviews.Content: Close to all Downtown attractions and Love Field. Clean, comfortable rooms; but it is the staff that makes this location excellent. Very attentive, helpful, pleasant staff from the front desk, to house keeping, and the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CoreyS714
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter and I traveled here to visit Family and take in some of the wonderful sites found around the downtown Dallas area. When we first arrived we were very impressed with the hotel staff, they all greeted us as if we were Royalty, everyone said, "Welcome". We got checked in within a matter of minutes, and I really appreciated the fact they took notice of my young daughter and made sure we got a room that would best accommodate our family. Our room was fantastic, it had everything we needed and more. They went through a complete remodel just recently so everything was brand new. The housekeeping staff was also very friendly, and made sure we had everything we needed in the room. Besides visiting with family that live near the area, we had an opportunity to see the sites around the hotel, which a lot of them you can just walk to, for instance the Dallas Aquarium (which is Great), The Dallas Zoo, The located where JFK was assassinated and the museum near by. Also the Hotel has a very modern looking nightclub, that I wish we had an opportunity to experience but unfortunately, No babysitter...To make it short, there was a ton of things to do there and not enough time. On the nights we didn't go out and eat we decided to eat at the restaurant in the hotel. There food was really good, they had a little bit of everything on the menu and all the items we had eaten they were all top notch. So to sum up our experience at the hotel I would just say it was incredible, from the staff and the way we were treated to the hotel accommodations and then the food. We had it all and everything was great. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone looking for a great place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but lousy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Franksapene
Reviews.Content: It is perfectly located, you will probably have to get your baggage to your room. We had a room with an AC filtration and the carpet was wet. Good breakfast with all common options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza at the beginning of the month, customer service was excellent, from the time we checked in till the time we checked out, the employees at the front desk were awesome, the restaurant food was scrumptous, and our room was wonderful, everyone treated us as if we were family. I received a phone call from the front desk shortly after we checked in to insure that our room was good and it was. Being a Priority Club Member we received an amenity that was brought up to our room and free breakfast which was wonderful, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Downtown area”
Reviews.Author: GingerJune86
Reviews.Content: For a top location in the downtown area, this place can't be beat. My husband and I stayed here this past March for the Rock 'n Roll Half Marathon, and we were able to avoid the hassles of parking by staying here since the Convention Center is just a few blocks away. The restaurants of the West End are also within walking distance, so we were able to have our top pick to fill up on plenty of carbs before the race. (We chose the Spaghetti Warehouse by the way, I definitely recommend it!) The beds were comfortable, the hotel was quiet, and the staff made us feel welcome throughout our two night stay. We will be returning for the marathon next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great and caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: BayareaBayboy
Reviews.Content: stayed here with our group of teenagers and never have felt such a warm welcome as we did whan we arrived at the Crowne Plaza. All the staff went out of there way to make sure our group was all settled in and they even called our rooms to let us know if there was anything they could do to make our stay more comfortable to do not hesitate to call the front desk.......Great Customer Service and yes we will be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “SCHOOL OR LARGE GROUPS BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kllewis
Reviews.Content: This weekend I took a school group of 22 teenagers to this hotel, First it was a packed weekend. The day was got there April 1, 2011, the pool was closed on a Friday!! Sunday morning was the only time the kids could swim, so as the sign says pool hours 5am-11pm. The kids woke up at 5am to go swimming, and of course the pool was locked! I had to take a pic of the sign to the front desk to get the door unlocked! That's not even saying how we had to step over two passed out drunk young people laying on the floor! Even after we got the door opened he worker didn't even wake them up!! Is this an upper class hotel or a Days Inn? When leaving on Sunday only 2 of the 4 elevators were working, so getting to the lobby took forever!! Over all customer service was ok! HOWEVER; after getting home and seeing how they went CRAZY with my credit card! They charged my card over $1000 in errors! Now after three days of being pushed off to person to person the problem STILL isn't fixed. I even had to call corporate just to get someone to stop given me the run around!!! If you use a credit card monitor your charges!!!! Not to include the young 20 somethings walking around the lobby drinking and drunk!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little details with their service really impressed me”
Reviews.Author: femtoamy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the Dallas Convention Center, an easy 4 block walk from the hotel. The Crowne Plaza has everything you'd expect from a business class hotel, but what really impressed me were the details. Like how the maid seemed to know exactly when I'd be out of the room (which varied throughout my 5 day stay), and never bothered me when I was inside doing work. The maid also kindly left the extra blankets and pillows I threw off the bed neatly piled in a corner instead of making me remove them daily. Room service was also great for dinner and cocktails, although a little lackluster for breakfast, and they once gave me a complimentary side of asparagus. When I had trouble with my internet (which was my computer's fault) they sent a guy up really fast to help out. And the view from the 14th floor was absolutely phenomenal. The room temperature control above the ceiling by the front door was a bit noisy, not to the point of losing sleep, though.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience with a hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CRMays
Reviews.Content: We went to Dallas for Super Bowl. It was a bad experience all around, but especially for us. I am on the Super Bowl committee and we had almost 100 prepaid rooms in this hotel. We arrived at 11pm. They gave excuses about mix ups with the keys, lost keys, a stack of keys that were not coded. This went on for a couple of hours as we talked to friends in the lobby. There was a party in the resturant and bar, so we couldn't go into those areas, they wouldn't serve us in the lobby as we waited and we couldn't even go to the bathroom. Finally they gave us a key to a room...that had someone in it. When we went back to the desk they RUDELY told us they were sold out and we would have to go to another hotel. My husband found a Hampton Inn that was new so wasn't sold out in the Super Bowl block. We got in at 2am. It was a very nice accomodating hotel. Unfortunately we moved back over to our "prepaid" room at Crowne Plaza the next day - to mediocre rooms, horrible food and bad management. Do not stay there! I have never written a bad hotel review and I travel several times per month. This hotel was HORRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: randerson678
Reviews.Content: The location was right in the middle of downtown, so security and saftey are a top concern. While my husband was checking in, I stayed in the car with the baby. I was scared a couple of times with strange people walking up to the lobby and around the car. The hotel provided no security or valet parking. Our room was regular size, big enough to fit a pack and play, but the closet space consisted of a poorly installed sliding mirror door. The air conditioning system dripped on the floor throughout our entire stay and even the service man could not fix the problem. We ended up putting a trash can under the drip. Our extended family was also staying at the hotel and they had to move rooms because the air conditioning system was not working at all in their room. Their service call was ignored a couple of times. The cleaning service did not come to clean our room until early evening. Our friends had their car broken into over night, and come to find out, there were multiple cars that were broken into with the same item missing. Overall the service was poor, the secuirty was very poor, and the promptness to resolve a problem was poor. I will not return to this hotel and I will not recommend this hotel to other friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Just raze the building and start over”
Reviews.Author: divefan
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty ordinary, and the bed not great. Even on the 14th floor the street noise was loud. We had to chase down our waitress to get our check in the restaurant. The bathroom was so small you had to close the door in order to be able to sit down.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ THIS FIRST!!!”
Reviews.Author: fmedley
Reviews.Content: YOU WOULD HAVE TO BE ON CRACK COCAINE TO GIVE THIS HOTEL A 5 STAR RATING!!! Most travelers never read the 1 star ratings! Take the time and read the terrible, poor and average ratings on this hotel as well, you will see a pattern. We travel at least twice a month, mixing business with pleasure. We are experienced travelers. This hotel is terrible! The hotel staff is the rudest, most unprofessional, non-caring staff you will ever meet! In my 25+ years of traveling I've never EVER experienced hotel service as bad as I experienced it from this place, even traveling to 3rd world countries! Upon arrival we noticed several unhappy people screaming and yelling at the front desk, after overhearing a couple of conversations we discovered the hotel didn't have any rooms available for them. I wasn't worried standing there listening because in the back of my mind I knew we booked our room and PRE-PAID for it 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE! WRONG! When I approached the front desk the hotel manager said "We sold your room too and we don't have any more rooms available!" I proceeded to tell him "you have my money, I paid already for 3 nights, you charged my credit card!" He didn't care! As I screamed at the hotel manager a local policeman standing in the lobby pulled me aside and said "Just don't hurt him, this is a problem hotel, we never hear anything positive about this place, even the food is bad, scream all you want, they deserve it, just don't hit him!" I knew then this was an ongoing problem and I made a mistake booking this hotel, needless to say it was 11pm at night with nowhere to go! I was blessed to get my money back but others didn't! I'm sure they disputed it with the their credit card company! FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO STAY! By the way this is a very old hotel as well and check out the bad ratings from hotels.com!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Dealey Plaza”
Reviews.Author: iantoes
Reviews.Content: We had come to Dallas specifically to go to Dealey Plaza so here was perfect, it did say that there were parking charges but we did not get charged so I am not sure really, it was a Friday so maybe they get waived at week-ends? Main Street is also a short walk away with restaurants and bars. Dealey Plaza is easily walkable but could we find a breakfast place othet than McDonalds? No we could not except at the hotel which was not the 'diner' we were looking for, go for it no problems. Only issue was classical music all night from somewhere outside but at the hotel, never did find it!

Reviews.Title: “Crap hotel with crap costumer service”
Reviews.Author: sam12la
Reviews.Content: horrible costumer service and rude staff- hung up on me a few time and the manager returns my calls. booked my reservation on the phone and for some reason wrong month booked - they charged my credit card and now are saying its not refundable and I have to pay twice. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, good service, good value”
Reviews.Author: Ben_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza met my expectations for a hotel in this class. The customer service was outstanding (Merle at the front desk stood out), and the price was great. The room was nothing special, though it had a flat-screen TV. The bathroom, as other reviewers stated, was pretty small, though big enough for me (and I'm an urbanite used to small bathrooms, too). The best thing about the hotel was the parking situation. I was very happy to be able to park myself in a garage (located on the lower floors of the hotel) and get in and out easily, without the delays (and tips!) of valet service. The restaurant is not good and very overpriced--skip it. Overall, I'd stay here again if I can't find a room Uptown, which is where I prefer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Non-refundable for booked room”
Reviews.Author: bswift123
Reviews.Content: Do not book a stay at this hotel until you are absolutely certain that you have no other options in Downtown Dallas.
