They have a non-refundable room policy and will charge you for a one night stay regardless of how far in advance you cancel your reservation. Buyer beware, very aware of what you're doing before you make a reservation at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for donwtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ttb888
Reviews.Content: Staying here as I write this. Conference at Convention Center. The hotel is on the corner of Griffin/Elm. A pleasant 4 block walk down Griffin leads you directly into the Griffin St main entrance of the Convention Center. The Crowne Plaza hotel itself is what would be expected from a metro Crowne Plaza - excellent. Make sure you use the complimentary security-enabled wi-fi as it has significantly better reception than the regular network. Get latest password from desk or hotel operator. Had to take one star away from the service as there is no bellhop and you have to drag your own bags upstairs. At least there is a bag dolley. Would rather stay here than the Convention hotels Aloft and Magnolia. Normally should receive a much better rate than those hotels making for good value. Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: TylerTXFamily
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I had to attend a hearing at the Immigration Court on Dec 9, 2010 at the Earle Cabell Federal Building just 3 blocks away - just 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. I was greeted by Ingrid - she checked me in and made me feel very welcome. I was a priority club member so I was given a welcome back with treats, invited to the manager's cocktail mixer, and a voucher for a buffett breakfast the next day. She gave me a password for a secured wireless internet. I used the internet to prepare for court the next day. PARKING is just $12.00 and the parking garage is attached to the hotel and you can go in and out using your room key. I stayed at two ultra luxury hotels in the same area and the parking was over $25.00 per day plus you have to use a valet that takes your car to some unknown location and you have to wait for your car and tip each person. The Crowne Plaza garage is convenient and safe. You can access your car very easily. If you have business in Downtown Dallas - the hotel has a shuttle to take you nearby and you can keep your car in the garage. I got down to breakfast and it was awesome. You can eat and eat and eat or just have something light yet filling. The coffee was great. The staff was very friendly. As I checked out - I was helped by Nathan - he was courteous and informative. I have to go back to Immigration Court in March for two days and I will make my reservation at the Crowne Plaza again and I recommend it to everyone else. The two other "luxury" hotels in the area can learn from the Crowne Plaza - which offers a great value and the Crown Plaza IS VERY LUXURIOUS.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel at Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroGO
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It was recently refurbished so everything is new and working. The location is excellent, very close to the main office buildings of Downtown Dallas, one block away from a train station and plenty of restaurants at walking distance. The personnel are service oriented and helped in every respect. Internet service is free. This hotel is an excellent place to stay when visiting Downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jizuda
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, good restaurant, fit center, swimming pool, quiet, good location and nice people

Reviews.Title: “Valet Avoidance Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrTexas
Reviews.Content: The large downtown Dallas hotels all require off-site or valet parking except this hotel. Parking is convenient and your vehicle is easy to access during your stay -- and no waiting for the valet to bring up the car. The front desk staff was pleasant and professional. This hotel has shown improvement over the past two years since converting from the interim "West End" name. The circular bar makes good use of space and had charming staff. Although there is no executive lounge, the priority platinum package of chocolates and pecans was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded all of my expectation for my overnight business stay!”
Reviews.Author: LuvHunter
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Crowne Plaza Downtown Dallas I was greeted by bell staff and front desk staff in a courteous and professional manner. As a Platinum Ambassador, staff used my name in every correspondence. I found my room to be neat, clean and quiet. I had cocktails that night in the lounge and found a lively, yet friendly crowd being taken care of by a great hostess and bartender (quite nice looking, I might add). The following morning, the restaurant provided a hearty, hot buffet and went so far as to prepare my eggs especially the way I like them. The hotels courtesy van provided convenient transportation to my downtown meeting site. I felt refreshed and ready for a hard day's work. I would recommend this property for anyone planning a stay or meeting in downtown Dallas

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhishek84
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel..location is really good. There are plenty of food places in surrounding of this hotel. There are quiet a few casinos too. Great hotel if you are on business trip and want to enjoy night life in surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ATTENTION TO OUR NEEDS”
Reviews.Author: DallasSergio
Reviews.Content: Hotel made sure to ask purpose of trip and what our needs may be. Offered to take us where ever we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: maxtandlarry
Reviews.Content: Great Service from front desk, restaurant and club.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: fieldshoward
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Great American Truck Show and had an awesome time. The rooms are nice the service is EXCELLENT and the venue was walking distance. Will definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very efficient”
Reviews.Author: jackandjill4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the center of downtown Dallas in an old 60s style block. On the inside it is modern and very efficient with all possible amenities. Rooms are large and comfortable, as well as quiet. Free wifi was noticeably quicker than in other hotels. There is also a pool, although that was pretty dirty when we were there. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Dealey Plaza and about two blocks from the west end restaurants and other attractions. Parking costs about $12 but is very efficient and you can drive in and out as much as you want. You can easily get to most of Dallas' highways within a few minutes of leaving the hotel. There is also a free shuttle bus that will take you anywhere within 3 miles. At about $100 per night, the hotel was very good value. The only downside was that the cleaning people failed to clean the room, make up the bed or empty the bins, although that is probably more a reflection of the attitude of the 18th floor cleaning crew than the hotel as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Crowne Plaza Hotel Dallas,Texas”
Reviews.Author: jgjg37
Reviews.Content: From check-in to departure everything was outstanding, we would recommend this hotel to all our friends and bussness partners

Reviews.Title: “terrific”
Reviews.Author: Manol_26
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively on business & look for hotels that offer a central location for eating, entertainment & busines acess. This hotel is centrally located to the business & government area. It is also adjacent to the Texas Club fitness center (which offers a free 14 day trial), to the West End entetainment area, & the Victory Park area. The hotel shuttle also provides transportation within a 3 mile radius which makes it convenient to the McKinney Strreet restuarants, Walgreens, Target, Albertsons, etc. Also the hotel staff is very helpful. Manuel-El Paso

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced and not what I had expected”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLove_33
Reviews.Content: My family and I planned a trip to the Dallas area for vacation. We booked a room at the Crowne Plaza Hotel and what a disappointment it was! The one good thing about our stay was the location of the hotel. It was within walking distance of several attractions we visited. We paid $150 for our room for one night. Not to mention the hotel charges a $12 parking fee, in which we had difficulty finding a parking spot. If you are driving a large SUV you might want to park your vehicle in a nearby parking lot. Our SUV barely cleared. When we got to the hotel, we checked in and might I add the person checking us in wasn't especially friendly. We got our room keys and headed to our room which was on the tenth floor. We fidgeted with the door for about 10 minutes before we gained access. An odd odor loomed in the room, which was weird because housekeeping supposedly just cleaned the room. I attempted to go to the "tiny" bathroom, and had difficulty. I had to squeeze in the door and stand beside the bathtub to shut the door. The bathroom was dirty. By then we were exhausted and didn't feel like going out for dinner, so we decided we were going to order room service. The price of a meal at this hotel was ridiculous. Not to mention they charge a delivery fee, tax, etc. My family and I were disappointed with the entire experience, so we decided to leave the hotel and go back home. I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel policy puts guests at risk of identity theft”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel86
Reviews.Content: When checking in, this hotel requires that a photocopy of the guest's driver's license be made and kept with credit card information and is not destroyed for approximately 30 days (destroyed how and by whom?) This is a perfect combination for identity theft. Hotel staff justifies this requirement stating that they need information in the event there is a theft of property from the room, and the information will be turned over to the police. They went on to provide specifics about past thefts that have occurred which made me very uneasy about staying here. We stayed for one night and then departed the very next morning. While requiring photo identification upon check in is an understandable and necessary requirement, having copies of government documents containing private information contained on a driver's license puts every guest at risk for identity theft. Assuming that every guest is a potential "thief" does not make for good guest relations or perception.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with many options to exercise, shop, eat, rest or read.”
Reviews.Author: hojokat
Reviews.Content: We had a great room on the 15th floor with a view of the outdoor swimming pool. While my husband was in meetings I read while exercising on excellent machines in the exercise room, ate 3 meals in the great new restaurant and swam and read by the outdoor pool. In the past I have also shopped and ate in restaurants within walking distance. All staff members with whom I came in contact were helpful and responsive in meeting our needs. I highly recommend the Dallas Crowne Plaza Hotel and will return for another visit in the future! Kathleen D. Johnson & Dr. Howard C. Johnson Dripping Springs, TX

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMarie01
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at this Hotel and I really enjoyed it. The shuttle service was a great help and the driver friendly and helpful. The food in the resturant was above my expectations. The front desk staff made me feel welcome from the moment I entered the lobby. I would like to acknowldge and thank the following people. Stephan has a true sense of customer service. along with Shante, Nathan, Andrea, Josh, Ingrid, Nina . Thank you !!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not worth the price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdberthia
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. I love the downtown area and it has easy access to the freeway. The first problem was arriving two hours prior to check-in. I spoke with the front desk clerk and i understood i was two hours early and could not check-in. i had a request to stay on an upper floor and i was assured the room was on the 19th floor however it wasnt ready yet. I left the hotel and returned at 4:30 (an hour and a half after check-in) I once again went to the front desk clerk who was not the same as the first person and not very nice, I checked in and was told my room was still not ready three and a half hours after i first arrived (i could have cleaned the room in that amount of time). Now i was told my room would be on the 16th floor, this was ok . I also asked about upgrading to a room with a balcony which i saw on the website but guess they are just for show, the clerk said you can't access the balconies because they are not up to code. (HINT: dont advertise something if something is obviously unavailable). On arrival to the room, there was one bar of very small soap and hair conditioner, i called housekeeping several times with no answer just an answering machine i did not leave a message. I did have a great view of the pool and was ready to get in that evening since it didn't close until 11:00pm. i got into the shower and 10 minutes later i hear someone open the rdoor to my door and say housekeeping. I could not understand why they would be just walking into the room i yelled and he went away. i notified the front desk as i was leaving for dinner about the toiletries and inquired about the time the pool closed.again i was told 11:00. So i went out for dinner and returned to find the toiletries. The second problem was parking. I was in a vehicle that was taller than the entrance to the parking deck i was given two options of parking, 1. in an unsecure parking lot across the street however you could only park ther unitl midnight, 2. a fenced parking area several blocks from the hotel. We ended up parking behind the building in a very unsecure location. back at the hotel from dinner, i decided to go for a swim got into my suit and walked to the pool what do i see a pool closed sign, back to the room. Once in the room i felt rather warm although i had put the thermostat to 71 degrees prior to leaving for dinner. i think it was more like 75 degrees all night long. The bathroom area is so small there may be a 2-3 inch clearance between the door and toilet when the door is open. The next day i after a long day at Six Flags i wanted to take a swim but no the pool was closed again, another disappointment. After another warm night of sleep i got up to use the restroom and almost fell entering the bathroom because the sink was now leaking. I did let the front desk clerk know of some of the problems experienced and he was nice enough to take the 16.00 dollar movie charge off the bill. There was one part of the hotel that was great and it's the restaurant "THRIVE" nice decor and great breakfast but a little expensive. Also three of the four front desk clerks i met were really nice. I definitely think this hotel was very overpriced for a king leisure room my rate the first night was $149 the rate the second night was $129, at most i think the rooms should not be over $70.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: jayjay201082
Reviews.Content: I keep coming back to the Crown Plaza Hotel. I find the staff to be accommodating,and the room comfort it flawless. I am striving toward Platinum ststus with this particular hotel. It is centrally located, ideal for my needs (I am without a vehicle).

Reviews.Title: “It'll do. They try hard.”
Reviews.Author: Eminence_Grise01
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that we were told our rooms weren't available at check-in time. They didn't have two singles w/ king-size beds unless we were willing to take ones with handicapped bathrooms. My advice: I did - don't you do it. Wait for the a regular bathroom that has actual counters, etc. Makes your three day stay much easier. One good thing was the hotel's shuttle - available to drop you off or pick you up within a 3-mile radius. Saves on taxis. The HVAC for the room was too noisy and the attempt by housekeeping to quiet it down was partially effective. Morning continental breakfast was inadequate for $12.50.

Reviews.Title: “European quality”
Reviews.Author: einervonuns
Reviews.Content: Many US-hotels lie near to a terribly loud high- or freeway. Not the Dallas Crown Plaza downtown. It's quiet, the service is friendly and excellent, the beds are marvellous, plenty of nice blankets and cushions, everything tidy and clean, these people care about satisfied customers. There is a big pool with a great view over Dallas downtown, an excellent restaurant and a big lobby without the loud music you have to listen to everywhere else. Fabulous prices, and you are in the middle of downtown the moment you leave the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with substandard service”
Reviews.Author: birdmanbh3
Reviews.Content: I'm a Priority Club member and stay at a lot of IC-group hotels, and this hotel was the worst I've encountered. The rooms and amenities are quite acceptable for the Holiday Inn class, but fall a bit short for Crowne Plaza. But it's the lack of service and attention that really makes the difference here: When I tried to check in, they had no record of my reservation and were booked solid. After I spent an hour talking to them and to our corporate travel department, they told me that they had a room for one night only. The next morning I found out that they had given my reservation away to a guest whose first name was the same as my last name, and that I had indeed had a reservation. The only compensation offered was a free breakfast (which perhaps should have been included for Priority Club members). Their excuse? "There's a convention in town and we're busy." The room itself also had problems: a stuck sink drain (which I fixed myself), dead batteries in the door lock (delayed me another 20 minutes), missing light bulbs in the bedside lamp (shock hazard for small children) and a missing smoke detector (serious violation of Dallas fire code). All of these were fixed after I let them know, but shouldn't have been a problem in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Crowne Plaza?”
Reviews.Author: ETXEMS
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time Priority Club member and prefer Crowne Plaza when I am in a major city. Except this one. Everything started out OK, the Priority check-in was fine. No Priority Club perks here.... even at Express properties PC members typically get a bottle of water at check in, but not at this Crowne Plaza. The room was nice, but no typical Crowne Plaza amenities such as the sleep package, etc. Did take advantage of the complimentary shuttle to the 6th Floor Museum and they were prompt and courteous. Dinner was another story. We canceled our reservations at an outside restaurant and decided on room service. Only problem is that the restaurant is closed for renovations. No mention of that on reservation or at check-in. Front desk turned us on to a nearby Chinese restaurant that delivers until 4am... but no menus and no website. Bedding was not upgraded. Other Crowne Plazas I have stayed at lately had very nice bedding with Tempurpedic mattresses, these were the old circa 2000 mattresses. Nice pillow set though. All in all, the room and property is OK, but only OK. This is an HI Express masquerading as a Crowne Plaza. My advice is stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Crowne Plaza was NOT...”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirl578
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Crowne Plaza was NOT worth the price we paid to stay there. First of all you have to pay extra just to park your vehicle in the hotel's parking garage. Next, the front desk clerks were not helpful, slow, and unfriendly. There were no luggage racks available, the pool was a nasty green color (in June), when we ran out if coffee in our room, there was no coffee anywhere else in the hotel and we were told we would have to wait for housekeeping to come in before getting another coffee packet. Then we the hotel's shuttle refused to take us 1/2 a mile down the road to the convention center "due to too many requests for that location." I'm not sure I understand that reasoning. So we had to pay a taxi to take us and bring us back to the hotel. Oh! And before you order room service- be sure and read the fine print at the bottom of the menu there is a "delivery fee", "gratuity", and tax added to your total. I will steer people AWAY from staying at The Crowne Plaza on Elm.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: maidenfan87
Reviews.Content: We visited Dallas for the Iron Maiden concert, and I was very impressed. The hotel was in a great location, and the gentleman at the front desk, Mr. Shunte Nettles, informed us that we were only a few blocks away from Dealey Plaza. After holding our bags for us, he gave us walking directions. It started to rain as we came back, and upon arriving, Mr. Nettles gave us towels as we waited for our room to be cleaned. I've never experienced service like that on the road before. After our room was cleaned, we got checked in immediately. I will return to this hotel every time I visit Dallas because of the service that I got from Mr. Nettles. Thanks Shunte for going above and beyond to make our stay more enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying with comfort and affordability.”
Reviews.Author: froglover1548
Reviews.Content: We did not plan our stay before we got here. we wanted to find a play when we got here. Already knew we wanted under 150.00 a night. after calling around it did not look like we were going to accomplish that goal and be able to enjoy just walking every in th city. We just happened to pass the crowne plaza by chance so i called and was amazed. This place ended being better than the others, cheaper,and the people were so much nicer. Everyone went out of their way to help us here. They took me the store and helped me with my crisis instead of just telling me where to go. i thank everyone here for being so kind. We plan on bringing our family back to dallas and we will for sure be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel with the best staff and rates!”
Reviews.Author: nakialove
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Crowne Plaza Downtown location and I love it here. The staff is always nice and available to help make your stay there enjoyable. Anytime I need a quick get away in town this is where I will continue coming.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: JaneMUK
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Crowne Plaza hotel, staff are courteous and the location is good for access to 6th floor museum and other museums. Hotel has a free shuttle service within a 3 mile radius. The rooms are very small and the bathroom in particular is tiny, you have to shut the door to sit on the toilet!! The pool is freezing and not heated and for some reason the hotel chains all the poolside chairs and loungers together, who knows why they do that!! The hotel has a business suite with 5-6 computers and high speed printer. I managed to get a room for under $100 which made the stay acceptable, paying anything more would in my opinion make this an expensive location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has potential”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel in downtown Dallas. As far as location is concerned, it is walking distance from several eating establisments. I highly recommend going over to Market Street, where there is everything from a Sonny Bryant's, Spaghetti Warehouse, TGI Friday's, and a Butcher Shop Steakhouse. The hotel is also right down the street from the Texas School Book Depository at Dealy Plaza. To check into the hotel, you must pull into the self-park garage and get a ticket. There is no valet parking. When you get inside, mention to the hotel clerk that you are parked in the garage and they will activate your hotel key for entry and exit into the garage. The hotel has a nice restaurant, which I used every day at lunch. The food is good and reasonably priced. There is also a hotel bar, and a nightclub which is open on the weekend. This can be a plus or a minus, depending on your perspective. I found it to be a minus. The nightclub patrons practically take over the hotel, from the garage, to the lobby, to the elevators, to the rooms and they make plenty of racket. I awoke one time at 4am to revelers on the pool deck, even though it is clearly marked that it should be closed at 11pm. I also witnessed several club goers horsing around in the elevators, which can be rather annoying. They must make a lot of money from the club, but as a hotel guest I would suggest closing it down because it detracts from the overall hotel experience. The room was very nice and clean. It had the standard hotel amenities, as well as a mask and earplus so you can sleep better. You might need them on the weekends when the nightclub is open, although they may cause you to oversleep your alarm. The internet connection was very flaky at first, but improved during the week. The staff told me they were in the process of changing from one internet provider to another, and that they had to change the router that they were using. My room included a refrigerator, but no microwave although I heard from other guests that the hotel could lend one if you requested it. We were also working at the hotel, and generally speaking they were easy to work with. The first thing that concerned me were the amount of maintenance they were doing on the floor where we were working, and the noise was rather distracting. The second thing that concerned me was that a hotel staff member interrupted our session and "Shushed" us to keep it down, even though we never spoke above a normal conversational tone. Overall, it's a nice hotel, but I really suggest they close that nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: justavisit424
Reviews.Content: location was fine. Many restaurants within a couple of blocks. Lots of precautions to prevent homeless from wandering into hotel. Common areas are fine, but the rooms have some problems: could never get the heat to work (colleague had the same problem in another room on a different floor). Always blew cold air. Sink dripped constantly, toilet and bathtub are really close together and the bathroom smelled as though a male guest(s) may have missed the target and urinated on the shower curtain. Smell was strong. Seems as though housekeeping should have smelled the stench when the bathroom was cleaned. Fitness room has enough equipment, but two of three treadmills didn't work. Instead go to the Y nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, slow elevators!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chester_dallas
Reviews.Content: Here's the scoop, I got a great deal on this hotel for New Years Eve. My wife and I partied in downtown Dallas and needed a place to stay. It was very reasonable and the rooms were pretty nice. The only problem is that because it was New Years Eve, the place was packed and it took forever to get up and down the elevators. Maybe on a regular night the 4 elevetors would be fine and there would be little waiting, but on a busy night like that, they needed twice as many elevators!!! Besides that the rooms were nice, the staff was friendly and the lobby bar was great!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Dallas Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1015 Elm St, Dallas, TX 75202
